qas.question: Who lived in native communities, speaking the language and participating in the affairs of tribes?
Why were some multiracial children sent to Europe?
Where were legal wives usually kept?
What were Indigenous Americans living among Europeans called?
Who was less numerous than "white indians"?
Where did Indigenous Americans keep bases?
Who was sent to Indigenous American schools for their education?

context: Some <a0_0>Europeans living among Indigenous Americans<a0_0/> were called <a2_0>"<b5_0>white Indians<b5_0/>"<a2_0/>. They "lived in native communities for years, learned native languages fluently, attended native councils, and often fought alongside their native companions." More numerous and typical were <b6_0><b7_0>traders and trappers<b7_0/><b6_0/>, who married Indigenous American women from tribes on the frontier and had families with them. <a1_0>Some traders<a1_0/>, who kept bases in the <b8_0>cities<b8_0/>, had what ware called "country wives" among Indigenous Americans, with legal European-American wives and children at home <a4_0>in the city<a4_0/>. Not all abandoned their "natural" mixed-race children. Some arranged for <b9_0>sons<b9_0/> to be sent to European-American schools <a3_0>for their education<a3_0/>.
